newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at 13.0/14.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at 13.0/14.0 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at 13.0/14.0 percent in late morning trading on Monday from 11/12 percent at the opening, dealers said.
They said the overnight interbank rate edged higher after a slight increase in demand, but liquidity remained largely sufficient following the central bank's early injection of 863 billion rupiah.
The central bank offered one-week bilateral SBIs at 6.5 percent, two-week at 8.25, one-month at 10.25, three-month at 10.75, six-month at 11.50 and one-year at 12.0 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Friday was 13.75 percent against 15.38 percent on Thursday.
